title: Cravat End, early 18th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: needle lace with ground of loop and twist with twist return
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Cravat end with a central design of abstract foliated forms flanked by identical stylized representations of trees surrounded by an intricate pattern of volutes, urns, and rocaille decoration.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cravat End, early 18th century.
early 18th century. Medium: linen
Technique: needle lace with ground of loop and twist with twist return. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-7.
